ranked_diseases.explanation: This syndrome matches many of the patient's features including micrognathia, frontal bossing, underdeveloped nasal alae, intellectual disability, delayed speech and language development, delayed ability to walk, and short stature. Rod-cone dystrophy and brachydactyly are also reported in some cases.

This syndrome includes features such as micrognathia, downslanted palpebral fissures, low-set ears, macrotia, intellectual disability, and delayed development. However, rod-cone dystrophy and Chiari malformation are less commonly associated.

Noonan Syndrome can present with short stature, low-set ears, downslanted palpebral fissures, and delayed development. However, features like rod-cone dystrophy and Chiari malformation are not typical.
This syndrome includes rod-cone dystrophy, brachydactyly, and intellectual disability, but other features like Chiari malformation and micrognathia are not commonly associated.
This syndrome includes features such as micrognathia, underdeveloped nasal alae, delayed development, and intellectual disability. However, rod-cone dystrophy and Chiari malformation are not typical.
